{{Wireless embedded system |brand=GL.iNet |model=GL-AR300M |revision=-EXT (MD/Lite) |asin=B01I92T754,B01K6MHRJI |est_release_date=2017 |fcc_date=09/14/2016 |is_manuf=No |type=travel router |fcc_id=2AFIW-AR300M |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |cpu1_model=QCA9531;QCA9531-BL3A; |cpu1_cspeed=650 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model=W25Q128FVSG |fla2=128 |fla2_brand=GigaDevice |fla2_model=GD5F1GQ4UCYIG |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Etron |ram1_model=EM68C16CWQE-W5H |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, PCIe (non-standard connector) |expansion_usb_minipcie=1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=yes,, 4-pad header,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=QCA9531;QCA9531-BL3A; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |stock_boot=U-Boot |stock_os=Linux;3.18.20;OpenWrt 15.05; |tp_firmware=OpenWrt, |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=GL-AR300M-XXX |default_ip=192.168.8.1 }} {{TagLine|Mini Smart Router}} [[File:ar300m_shop-1.jpg|600px]]
==Official Supports== :{{ProductPage|https://www.gl-inet.com/ar300m/}} :[https://store.gl-inet.com/collections/travel-routers/products/gl-ar300m-mini-smart-router Official Shop]
==Features== "GL-AR300M-V1.2.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
===Specifications=== *Interfaces: 1x WAN, 1x LAN, 1x USB2.0, PCIe, UART *Frequency: 2.4GHz 2T2R (+ 5GHz PCIe Card addon) *Transmission rate: 300Mbps, Max Tx Power: 20dBm *Power consumption: <3W (1x micro USB, no PoE) *Dimensions: 58x58x25 mm, Weight: 39g
===Description=== The GL-AR300M is the newest in the line of GL.iNet products as of early 2017. :It is available with internal or external antennas (GL-AR300M-EXT). It is a compact, squared shaped travel router that runs OpenWrt perfectly.
GL.iNet ships the device with their own version of OpenWrt, but they also :offer multiple clean OpenWrt images pre-built for their devices at [http://gl-inet.com/firmware/ FW]. The AR300M is identical in hardware to the ''GL.iNet AR300MD'', aside from :the fact that it does not ship with the 5GHz module installed. Unlike other GL.iNet routers, this model has no PoE support :(due to the 5GHz module taking up all the extra space). Power is provided by a Micro USB 5V 1A input.
